meanings.definition: To strengthen or invigorate mentally or physically.
meanings.sent1: Drinking warm tea can fortify your body during cold weather.
meanings.sent2: Exercise can help fortify your muscles and make you feel stronger.
meanings.sent3: Reading a good book can fortify your mind and transport you to new worlds.
meanings.sent4: Positive affirmations can fortify your spirit and help you face challenges.
meanings.sent5: Listening to uplifting music can fortify your emotions and bring joy to your day.

meanings.definition: To make stronger or more secure.
meanings.sent1: Adding extra locks to the door will fortify our home against intruders.
meanings.sent2: Eating nutritious food can fortify your immune system and keep you healthy.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a helmet can fortify your head and protect you during sports.
meanings.sent4: A strong foundation can fortify a building against earthquakes and other disasters.
meanings.sent5: Regular maintenance can fortify your car and prevent breakdowns on the road.

meanings.definition: To add nutrients to a food or drink.
meanings.sent1: The chef decided to fortify the soup with extra vegetables for added nutrition.
meanings.sent2: Many cereals are fortified with vitamins and minerals to improve health.
meanings.sent3: The idea to fortify milk with calcium came from a scientist studying nutrition.
meanings.sent4: Some countries fortify salt with iodine to prevent deficiencies in the population.
meanings.sent5: It is common practice to fortify orange juice with vitamin C for a healthy boost.
